DataElement.preferredName: Patient Monoclonal Antibody Infusion Hypersensitivity Personal Medical History Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response indicating whether or not a patient has a personal medical history of hypersensitivity to any monoclonal antibody.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Monoclonal Antibody Infusion Hypersensitivity Personal Medical History
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the patient's personal medical history of hypersensitivity, an exaggerated response by the immune system to an infusion of monocolonal antibody, an antibody produced by a clone or genetically homogenous population of hybrid cells i.e., hybridoma; hybrid cells are cloned to establish cell lines producing a specific antibody that is chemically and immunologically homogeneous.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Monoclonal Antibody Infusion Hypersensitivity Personal Medical History
Property.preferredDefinition: An antibody produced by a clone or genetically homogenous population of hybrid cells i.e., hybridoma; hybrid cells are cloned to establish cell lines producing a specific antibody that is chemically and immunologically homogeneous. They are widely used in cancer detection, diagnosis and treatment.:A method of putting fluids, including drugs, into the bloodstream. Also called intravenous infusion.:An exaggerated response by the immune system to a drug or other substance.:an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: An antibody produced by a clone or genetically homogenous fast-growing cells i.e., hybridoma. Hybridoma cells are cloned to establish cell lines producing a specific antibody that is chemically and immunologically homogeneous. They are widely used in cancer detection, diagnosis, and treatment.
Any form of treatment that is introduced into the body via a blood vessel, a muscle, or the spinal cord.
An exaggerated response by the immune system to a drug or other substance.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have a history o
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of severe hypersensitivity reaction to any monoclonal antibody?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of severe hypersensitivity reactions to other monoclonal antibodies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a known hypersensitivity or history of severe allergic reaction to tocilizumab or other monoclonal antibodies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of allergic reactions attributed to compounds of similar chemical or biologic composition to anti-GD2 monoclonal antibody (dinutuximab) or Hu5F9-G4 (magrolimab) monoclonal antibody or other agents used in this study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of greater than or equal to grade 2 infusion reactions or allergic reactions to humanized monoclonal antibodies?
